intro: Galium transsilvanicum, commonly known as the Transylvanian bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several minute seeds. Galium transsilvanicum typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
